newsitem.title: USA: Sheridan Healthcare backs $0.15 Q2 EPS view.
newsitem.headline: Sheridan Healthcare backs $0.15 Q2 EPS view.

text.p: Sheridan Healthcare Inc, a physician practice management company, said Wednesday it was comfortable with analysts' estimates calling for earnings of $0.15 a share in the second quarter.

"Right now, we are comfortable with the $0.15 earnings estimate that most analysts have," chief operating officer Michael Schundler said following a presentation at the Piper Jaffray investment conference here.
The Hollywood, Florida-based company reported earnings of $0.10 a share in the 1996 second quarter.
Schundler expressed concern regarding the higher end of analysts estimates for all of 1997.

"I think most of the analysts now have us between $0.60 and $0.63," he said. "The concern I have with the higher estimates is that they are dependant upon timely acquisitions and acquisitions are not something I can necessarily control. But I'm not uncomfortable with those higher numbers."
In 1996, the company reported earnings of $0.44 for the full year.
Schundler said the company's top priority is the acquisition of obstetrics practices, followed by interest in hospital-based neonatology and anesthesia contracts or acquisitions.

When the company sells its five primary care practices in which it shares financial risk, it will have 16 remaining practices evenly distributed between obstetrics/gynecology and primary fee-for service clinics. In those 16 practices, Sheridan does not share the financial risk, but collects a fee for each service.
Sheridan shares were unchanged at 11 Wednesday.
